title: Absolutely Ultimate Potato Soup
description: This creamy, comforting potato soup is the perfect warm-up on a chilly day, bursting with rich flavors from crispy bacon, fresh herbs, and velvety cream. Topped with crumbled bacon, green onions, or shredded Cheddar cheese, it’s a hearty treat that feels like a warm hug in a bowl.
ingredients: 4 cups chicken stock, or enough to cover potatoes
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Place bacon in a Dutch oven and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, 5 to 10 minutes.
Drain bacon pieces on paper towels and drain off all but 1/4 cup of the bacon grease.
Cook celery and onion in the reserved bacon drippings until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir in garlic and continue cooking for 1 to 2 minutes.
Add cubed potatoes and toss to coat. Sauté for 3 to 4 minutes.
Return bacon to the pan and add enough chicken stock to just cover the potatoes.
Cover and simmer until potatoes are tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, melt butter in a separate skillet over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook, stirring constantly, 1 to 2 minutes.
Whisk in heavy cream, tarragon, and cilantro.
Bring cream mixture to a boil and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes.
Add cream mixture to the potato mixture and stir to combine.
Transfer about half of the soup to a blender and purée, then return to the Dutch oven.
Adjust seasonings with salt and pepper to taste.
tips: For a bacon-free version, substitute 1/4 cup melted butter for the bacon grease. Use a sturdy blender to purée the soup smoothly, and don’t overcook the potatoes to keep a pleasant texture. Garnish with crispy bacon bits, fresh green onions, or shredded Cheddar for extra flavor and texture.

structured_content.content: This Absolutely Ultimate Potato Soup is a soul-warming dish that combines creamy textures with the smoky crunch of bacon and the fresh brightness of herbs. Its velvety richness and comforting aroma make it a standout recipe for cold days when you crave something hearty and satisfying.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 45 minutes
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for cozy weeknight dinners or entertaining guests
  • Uses simple, wholesome ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Customizable with toppings like cheese, bacon, or green onions for added texture and flavor

structured_content.content: I’ve made this soup countless times for family and friends, and it never fails to bring smiles and warm hearts. It’s one of those recipes that feels like a special treat, especially on cold winter evenings when everyone gathers around the table craving comfort food.

• Main ingredient: Yukon Gold or Russet potatoes work best for their creamy texture and ability to hold shape when cooked. Peel and cube evenly for uniform cooking.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Dried tarragon adds a subtle anise-like flavor, while fresh cilantro brings a bright herbal note. Use fresh garlic and onion for depth.
  • Supporting ingredients: Bacon provides smoky richness and texture, celery adds a mild crunch, and heavy cream creates the luscious base.
  • Equipment needed: A Dutch oven or heavy pot for even cooking, a skillet for making the roux, and a blender or immersion blender for puréeing the soup.

Preparation:
Chop bacon, dice celery and onion, mince garlic, peel and cube potatoes. This prep ensures smooth workflow during cooking.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Cook bacon until crisp, then sauté celery and onion in bacon drippings until translucent. Add garlic briefly, then potatoes to coat. Simmer with chicken stock until tender. Meanwhile, prepare a creamy roux with butter, flour, cream, tarragon, and cilantro, cooking until thickened. Combine the two mixtures, purée half for a creamy texture, and season to taste.
Finishing Touches:
Serve hot, topped with crispy bacon bits, shredded Cheddar, or chopped green onions for extra flavor and a colorful presentation.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Reserve some bacon grease to sauté vegetables for deeper flavor.
  • Don’t overcook potatoes to avoid a mushy soup; tender but firm is ideal.
  • The soup is ready when potatoes are soft and the cream mixture has thickened to coat the back of a spoon.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days; reheat gently to avoid curdling.

structured_content.content: This soup has been a centerpiece at many family gatherings, evoking memories of laughter and warmth. Sharing it with loved ones makes every spoonful even more special, turning simple ingredients into cherished moments.

Elevate this soup by adding smoked paprika for a smoky depth, a dash of cayenne for heat, or swapping fresh cilantro for parsley or chives. A splash of white wine in the cream mixture adds a subtle acidity that brightens the flavors.

Pair this soup with crusty artisan bread or a fresh green salad for a balanced meal. It also pairs beautifully with a crisp white wine or a light beer, making it perfect for casual dinners or special occasions.

For a vegetarian version, omit bacon and use vegetable broth with melted butter instead of bacon grease. Swap heavy cream for coconut milk to make it dairy-free, or add roasted cauliflower for a twist on the classic potato base.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Cook bacon slowly to render maximum flavor and crispiness without burning.
  • Whisk flour into melted butter off heat first to avoid lumps in the roux.
  • Blend only half the soup for a perfect balance of creamy and chunky textures.
  • Garnish with fresh herbs and a sprinkle of cheese for an impressive finish.

structured_content.content: With simple steps and wholesome ingredients, this soup invites you to enjoy the process and the delicious results. It’s a recipe that builds confidence and rewards you with every warm, comforting spoonful.
